alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 1:22AM PST until March 02 at 7:22AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. .Moderate to heavy rainfall will continue into Tuesday morning before tapering to scattered showers throughout the day. Area rivers will continue to rise this morning before the axis of heaviest moisture associated with the atmospheric river shifts further south. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Stillaguamish River At Arlington. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, the Stillaguamish River will cause flooding mainly in the Silvana area, along Norman Road and in Florence. A stage of 17 feet on the Stillaguamish River corresponds roughly to Phase 3 in the Snohomish County Flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:55 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:55 AM PST Tuesday was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.4 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage tonight. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 930 AM PST.
